sentences.en: An ancient pagoda frowns on the mountainside.
sentences.cn: 一座古塔阴森森地矗立在山腰上.

sentences.en: Many tourists puffed up the steep steps of the ancient pagoda.
sentences.cn: 许多旅游者喘着气登上古塔陡直的梯级.

sentences.en: Regardless of danger, he climbed the pagoda.
sentences.cn: 他不顾危险地爬上了高塔.

sentences.en: The ancient pagoda is still there, but not in its integrity.
sentences.cn: 那座古塔还在, 但是不完整了.

sentences.en: The ancient pagoda is undergoing repairs.
The guide pointed at a pagoda and told us that it was built hundreds of years ago.
sentences.cn: 导游指着一座宝塔,告诉我们说这是数百年前修建的.

sentences.en: The lofty pagoda stands like a giant at the top of the mountain.
The pagoda built in the Ming Dynasty is still in good repair.
sentences.cn: 建于明代的那座塔现在还完好无损.

sentences.en: The pagoda cast its shadow athwart the lake.
The pagoda has a base of heptagon.
sentences.cn: 这座宝塔有个七边形的底座。

sentences.en: The pagoda is perched on top of the hill.
The pagoda is reflected upside down in the water.
The Wild Goose Pagoda was dimly visible.
The word "Pagoda" was introduced to Europe by the 17th century Portuguese.
sentences.cn: Pagoda这个词由17世纪的葡萄牙人引入欧洲。

sentences.en: We opened a white pagoda to the port.
sentences.cn: 左舷方面看出一座白塔来了.

trans.tran_en: a Buddhist  temple (= religious building )  that has several levels with a decorated roof at each level
